hackathon-description-text: Valentine's Day is coming up, and what better way to show your love (or disdain) for the holiday by making a themed app or mobile game!
hackathon-eligibility:
Open to all SFU students, all experience levels welcome!
Max 10 non-SFU students (sorry, we're limited on space right now, we'll expand in the future)
hackathon-requirements:
Project Description
Team Members
Technology Used
Github repo link
hackathon-rules:
Teams of up to five members (can be solo if desired)
You can design and gather any resources you wish, be it art and sound assets, libraries, etc. early. But no code can be written before the event.  
The spirit of the event is to learn and create something new, therefore if your project is primarily a pre-made tutorial with some small changes and additions, it will not be accepted for judging.  
You can bring your own laptop and hardware.  
Submissions to Devpost must be made before the cut-off day/time.  
You will present at your station by individual judges, so you'll have to present multiple times.  This is so that no individual group has more time than others to prep their presentations.  
Harassing comments, images, and actions will not be tolerated.  Any individuals or groups found to break this rule will be asked to leave immediately.  We wish to create a welcoming environment.  Hacking is about making cool stuff, showing it off, and learning from each other.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=8888 University Dr, Burnaby, BC V5A 1S6, Canada
hackathon-location-address: 8888 University Dr, Burnaby, BC V5A 1S6, Canada
hackathon-description-header: Create a mobile-focused game or app revolving around Valentine's Day.
